strings.Value: "Thank you, Tristian. This is a precious gift."
"I wouldn't mind if we were closer."
"And you've been hiding these potions from me all this time?!"
{n}Tristian approaches you and makes a gesture to attract your attention.{/n} "{name}? Before we set off, I need to give you something."

"You've come to my rescue when I was preparing to meet the goddess. Accept my gratitude — and this." {n}Tristian takes a few potions from the bag and hands them to you.{/n} "There are only a few, but they will surely be useful to you in your journey through the {g|Stolen Lands}Stolen Lands{/g}."
{n}Tristian folds his hands and smiles at you.{/n} "I'm glad that I met you. If you need advice or help, I'll be around."
{n}Tristian blinks and then catches on.{/n} "Of course! I would be happy to call you my friend, {name}!"

{n}Tristian knits his brows and keeps silent for a few tense seconds.{/n} "I... I understand." {n}The priest smiles a crooked smile, then coughs and looks away.{/n} "We need to go. But I... I will be happy to talk to you again some time."
"I'm happy to help you. Well, I won't waste any more of your time." {n}Tristian nods to you and looks away.{/n}
{n}The smile drops from Tristian's face.{/n} "What? No! Oh, it doesn't matter. Anyway, they're yours now."
{n}Tristian laughs back.{/n} "All right! A friend in need is a friend indeed — in the {g|Stolen Lands}Stolen Lands{/g} we'll have many chances to check if that's true!"
